verse: To Moab: This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the God of Israel, says:
“Therefore, look, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I’ll send those who tip over vessels to him, and they’ll tip him over. They’ll empty his vessels and shatter his jars.
Moab will be ashamed because of Chemosh just as the house of Israel was ashamed because of Bethel, their confidence.
“From the cry of Heshbon, to Elealeh, to Jahaz they have lifted up their voice. From Zoar to Horonaim and to Eglath-shelishiyah, even the waters of Nimrim will become a desolate place.
In Moab,” declares the Lord, “I’ll put an end to the one who offers a burnt offering on the high place and to the one who burns incense to his gods.
Therefore my heart wails for Moab like flutes and my heart wails for the men of Kir-heres like flutes. Therefore they’ll lose the abundance they produced.
Indeed every head will be bald and every beard cut short. There will be gashes on all the hands and sackcloth on the loins.
On all the housetops of Moab and in the streets there will be nothing but mourning, for I’ll break Moab like a vessel that no one wants,” declares the Lord.
“How it will be shattered! How they’ll wail! How Moab will turn his back in shame! Moab will be an object of ridicule and terror to all those around him.”
